snippet: Older workers placed by programs like ReServe often do crucial jobs that would otherwise go undone.
abstract: Older workers placed by programs like ReServe often do crucial jobs that would otherwise go undone.
lead_paragraph: On Friday I wrote about ReServe, a program that connects retired professionals to part-time jobs in nonprofit organizations or city agencies.  Many ReServists, who earn $10 an hour, are working in city schools, including as college counselors in high schools in low-income neighborhoods.
